content.full_text:
Bill of Sale from John Ferguson to Alexander Trent, 25 January 18321 Know all men by these presents that IJohn Fergusonfor and in considderation of the Sum of thirty five dollars have given granted bargained

and Sold all my right and title in and to theNew Salem ferryin Sangamon County untoAlexander Trent2 In testimony whereof I have hereunto Set my hand this25thJanuary 1832
paragraphs: Bill of Sale from John Ferguson to Alexander Trent, 25 January 18321 Know all men by these presents that IJohn Fergusonfor and in considderation of the Sum of thirty five dollars have given granted bargained
and Sold all my right and title in and to theNew Salem ferryin Sangamon County untoAlexander Trent2 In testimony whereof I have hereunto Set my hand this25thJanuary 1832
citations:
Minutes, 5 March 1832, Sangamon County Commissioners’ Court Record Book C, 265, Manuscripts
                     Collection, Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library, Springfield IL.

footnotes.text:
1Abraham Lincoln wrote the entirety of the text on page one, including John Ferguson’s
                  signature.

2On March 5, 1832, theSangamon County Commissioners’ Courtapproved the sale and authorized Trent to operate the ferry at New Salem at the same
                  rates charged by previous ownerJames A. Richerson.Minutes, 5 March 1832, Sangamon County Commissioners’ Court Record Book C, 265, Manuscripts
                     Collection, Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library, Springfield IL.

structured_content.text: Bill of Sale from John Ferguson to Alexander Trent, 25 January 18321

Know all men by these presents that IJohn Fergusonfor and in considderation of the Sum of thirty five dollars have given granted bargained
               and Sold all my right and title in and to theNew Salem ferryin Sangamon County untoAlexander Trent2
In testimony whereof I have hereunto Set my hand this25thJanuary 1832
